verses.verse: Moreover I-yov <WH347> continued <WH3254> <WH8686> <WH5375> <WH8800> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>,
As 'Elohim <WH410> liveth <WH2416>, who hath taken away <WH5493> <WH8689> my judgment <WH4941>; and 'El SHaddai <WH7706>, who hath vexed <WH4843> <WH8689> my soul <WH5315>;
All the while <WH5750> my breath <WH5397> is in me, and the spirit <WH7307> of 'Elohim <WH433> is in my nostrils <WH639>;
My lips <WH8193> shall not speak <WH1696> <WH8762> wickedness <WH5766>, nor my tongue <WH3956> utter <WH1897> <WH8799> deceit <WH7423>.
'Elohim forbid <WH2486> that I should justify <WH6663> <WH8686> you: till I die <WH1478> <WH8799> I will not remove <WH5493> <WH8686> mine integrity <WH8538> from me.
My righteousness <WH6666> I hold <WH2388> <WH8689> fast, and will not let it go <WH7503> <WH8686>: my heart <WH3824> shall not reproach <WH2778> <WH8799> me so long as I live <WH3117>.
Let mine enemy <WH341> <WH8802> be as the wicked <WH7563>, and he that riseht up <WH6965> <WH8693> against me as the unrighteous <WH5767>.
For what is the hope <WH8615> of the hypocrite <WH2611>, though he hath gained <WH1214> <WH8799>, when 'Elohim <WH433> taketh away <WH7953> <WH8799> his soul <WH5315> ?
Will 'Elohim <WH410> hear <WH8085> <WH8799> his cry <WH6818> when trouble <WH6869> cometh <WH935> <WH8799> upon him?
Will he delight <WH6026> <WH8691> himself in 'El SHaddai <WH7706>? will he always <WH6256> call <WH7121> <WH8799> upon 'Elohim <WH433> ?
I will teach <WH3384> <WH8686> you by the hand <WH3027> of 'Elohim <WH410>: that which is with 'El SHaddai <WH7706> will I not conceal <WH3582> <WH8762>.
Behold, all ye yourselves have seen <WH2372> <WH8804> it; why then are ye thus altogether <WH1892> vain <WH1891> <WH8799> ?

This is the portion <WH2506> of a wicked <WH7563> man <WH120> with 'Elohim <WH410>, and the heritage <WH5159> of oppressors <WH6184>, which they shall receive <WH3947> <WH8799> of 'El SHaddai <WH7706>.
If his children <WH1121> be multiplied <WH7235> <WH8799>, it is for <WH3926> the sword <WH2719>: and his offspring <WH6631> shall not be satisfied <WH7646> <WH8799> with bread <WH3899>.
Those that remain <WH8300> of him shall be buried <WH6912> <WH8735> in death <WH4194>: and his widows <WH490> shall not weep <WH1058> <WH8799>.
Though he heap up <WH6651> <WH8799> silver <WH3701> as the dust <WH6083>, and prepare <WH3559> <WH8686> raiment <WH4403> as the clay <WH2563>;
He may prepare <WH3559> <WH8686> it, but the just <WH6662> shall put it on <WH3847> <WH8799>, and the innocent <WH5355> shall divide <WH2505> <WH8799> the silver <WH3701>.
He buildeth <WH1129> <WH8804> his house <WH1004> as a moth <WH6211>, and as a booth <WH5521> that the keeper <WH5341> <WH8802> maketh <WH6213> <WH8804>.
The rich <WH6223> man shall lie down <WH7901> <WH8799>, but he shall not be gathered <WH622> <WH8735>: he openeth <WH6491> <WH8804> his eyes <WH5869>, and he is not.
Terrors <WH1091> take hold <WH5381> <WH8686> on him as waters <WH4325>, a tempest <WH5492> stealeth him away <WH1589> <WH8804> in the night <WH3915>.
The east <WH6921> wind carrieth him away <WH5375> <WH8799>, and he departeth <WH3212> <WH8799>: and as a storm hurleth <WH8175> <WH8762> him out of his place <WH4725>.
For 'Elohim shall cast <WH7993> <WH8686> upon him, and not spare <WH2550> <WH8799>: he would fain <WH1272> <WH8800> flee <WH1272> <WH8799> out of his hand <WH3027>.
Men shall clap <WH5606> <WH8799> their hands <WH3709> at him, and shall hiss <WH8319> <WH8799> him out of his place <WH4725>.
